page.title: 02THE PARISH CHURCH
page.content: The Parish Church of St. Mary's and All Saints is now over 660 years old. It is a large church just off the market place with a tower and a spire. This tower can be seen from nearly everywhere in Bingham. It has 8 bells and they are rung every day. On the tower there are 4 clock faces which are light blue with gold hands and figures. There are 4 statues, one on each corner of the tower, of the 4 Bingham rectors who became Bishops. The church clock itself is 105 years old. One evening in 1975 when the clock was being wound, the eyebolt broke and the clock came crashing down. Luckily the choir had just moved from the place where it fell! After this accident the clock was electrified and 3 motors were put in, but the original clock remains.
